text:
Hi there,

I am using the jdbc taglibs to retrieve some data from mySQL. When i look at 
the data in my mySQL client, the international characters show up as they are 
supposed to. But when I use the taglibs and show the data on a webpage, the 
characters show up as ??. I have looked over the code for one of the classes 
and I think that you can solve the problem with international characters if you 
use getAsciiStream() instead of getCharacterStream(). The getCharacterStream 
returns unicode characters, and it looks like java dosen't know how to 
translate properly from unicode to asci.??

The characters that i have noticed that dosent come out right are: æ 
ø å &Aelig; Ø Å (escaped)

When i create a connection to the database with the regular jdbc and do my sql 
and retrieves the data from the resultset with rs.getString("fieldname") then 
everything turns up as supposed.

I am running on a Solaris 8/Intel with Danish character set. 640 Megs of ram 
and mySQL 3.22.25.  The jdbc driver I am using is: org.gjt.mm.mysql.Driver

I could fix the problem myself, but I would rather have you do the fixes, so i 
can cotinue to upgrade the taglibs. 

Thank you in advance.

Bjorn Smith
creator: bbs@smithfamily.dk
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
This seems a problem with the taglib, not with tomcat. I don't know how to transfer this bug to jakarta-taglibs, please file it again in the right 
product.

Encoding problems are quite difficult, and most of the time it's the browser who refuse to send the charset on the request - so nobody knows what's the right one to use. And of course, the default in the servlet api is 8859_1,
not UTF8, so unless you have a magic browser ( lynx is the only one to send 
the encoding ) you can have problems. In 3.3 we use per/session encoding, and 
you can set a default per context.
